intro: Hieracium munkacsense, commonly known as the Munkács hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, rough, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium munkacsense is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
